column1: Kingsland is a city in Camden County
column4: 946 at the 2010 census.The Kingsland Commercial Historic District was added to the National Register of Historic Places March 17
column5: 1994. It includes the area surrounding South Lee Street between King Street and William Street.

column1: Kingsland hosts an annual Catfish Festival on Labor Day weekend each year.
Kingsland is also home to Neutral Zone Studios
column2: where Star Trek fans can come and do their own Star Trek fan films
column3: the most notable being Star Trek Continues.

column1: Kingsland was platted in the 1894 when the railroad was extended to that point
column2: and was named after William Henry King
column3: the original owner of the town site.

column1: Kingsland is located in southwestern Camden County at 30°47′41″N 81°40′18″W (30.794612
column3: just north of the Florida line. It is bordered by St. Marys to the east. Interstate 95 runs through the eastern part of the city
column4: with access from three exits. U.S. Route 17
column5: an older highway running parallel to I-95
column6: passes through the center of Kingsland. Jacksonville
column8: is 36 miles (58 km) to the south
column9: and Brunswick is 34 miles (55 km) to the north.
